alert.note: Alert for Covington; Jasper; Jones; Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 17 at 4:28PM CST until February 17 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CST FOR SOUTHWESTERN JASPER...SOUTHEASTERN SMITH...NORTHEASTERN COVINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN JONES COUNTIES... At 427 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Taylorsville, or 10 miles west of Stringer, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Stringer and Bay Springs around 440 PM CST. Vernon around 445 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Mize. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for central, southeastern and east central Mississippi. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
